# Math 4610 Take Home Final

## Nitasha Jeske

## Problem 7:

**Implement the fast Fourier transform and apply to the problem in example 13.3. Use 32, 64, and 128 samples.**

Using the fft routine, we calculate the coefficients for the sine and cosine functions for sample sizes of 32, 64, and 128. That is we cut the interval from 0 to 2Pi 32 times and pass into the function the y values at these 32 points. What we get out of the function (shown in results section below) are the real and imaginary parts, real being the coefficient of the cosine function and the imaginary part being the coefficient of the sine function. We also may notice that all of the imaginary parts are approximately zero for each of the sample sizes. This means we are only going to end up with interpolation functions in terms of cosines. For examlple, the 32 sample would produce a trigonometric polynomial interpolation of: p(x) = 50.2655/2 -20.4374*cos(x) - 4.32686e-05cos(x) - 2.33014cos(x) + 3.23848e-05cos(x) + ... 

**Example:**
```C++
int main(){
    // to quickly determine the y values for 32 samples
    Vec val (32);
    for (int i=0; i<17; i++){
        val[i]=2*PI/32*i;
    }
    for (int i=17; i<32; i++){
        val[i]=2*PI-2*PI/32*i;
    }

    const Complex test[] = {0,  0.19635,  0.392699,  0.589049,  0.785398,  0.981748,  1.1781,  1.37445,  1.5708,  1.76715,  1.9635,  2.15984,  2.35619,  2.55254,  2.74889,  2.94524,  3.14159,  2.94524,  2.74889,  2.55254,  2.35619,  2.15984,  1.9635,  1.76715,  1.5708,  1.37445,  1.1781,  0.981748,  0.785398,  0.589049,  0.392699,  0.19635};
    CArray data(test, 32);

    cout<< "Sample size of 32: " << endl;
    fft(data);
    for (int i = 0; i < 32; ++i){
        std::cout << data[i] << std::endl;
    }

    // to quickly determine the y values for 64 samples
    Vec val2 (64);
    for (int i=0; i<33; i++){
        val2[i]=2*PI/64*i;
    }
    for (int i=33; i<64; i++){
        val2[i]=2*PI-2*PI/64*i;
    }

    const Complex test2[] = {0,  0.0981748,  0.19635,  0.294524,  0.392699,  0.490874,  0.589049,  0.687223,  0.785398,  0.883573,  0.981748,  1.07992,  1.1781,  1.27627,  1.37445,  1.47262,  1.5708,  1.66897,  1.76715,  1.86532,  1.9635,  2.06167,  2.15984,  2.25802,  2.35619,  2.45437,  2.55254,  2.65072,  2.74889,  2.84707,  2.94524,  3.04342,  3.14159,  3.04342,  2.94524,  2.84707,  2.74889,  2.65072,  2.55254,  2.45437,  2.35619,  2.25802,  2.15984,  2.06167,  1.9635,  1.86532,  1.76715,  1.66897,  1.5708,  1.47262,  1.37445,  1.27627,  1.1781,  1.07992,  0.981748,  0.883573,  0.785398,  0.687223,  0.589049,  0.490874,  0.392699,  0.294524,  0.19635,  0.0981748 };
    CArray data2(test2, 64);

    cout<< "Sample size of 64: " << endl;
    fft(data2);
    for (int i = 0; i < 64; ++i){
        std::cout << data2[i] << std::endl;
    }

    // to quickly determine the y values for 128 samples
    Vec val3 (128);
    for (int i=0; i<65; i++){
        val3[i]=2*PI/128*i;
    }
    for (int i=65; i<128; i++){
        val3[i]=2*PI-2*PI/128*i;
    }

    const Complex test3[] = {0,  0.0490874,  0.0981748,  0.147262,  0.19635,  0.245437,  0.294524,  0.343612,  0.392699,  0.441786,  0.490874,  0.539961,  0.589049, 0.638136,  0.687223,  0.736311,  0.785398,  0.834486,  0.883573,  0.93266,  0.981748,  1.03084,  1.07992,  1.12901,  1.1781,  1.22718,  1.27627,  1.32536,  1.37445,  1.42353,  1.47262,  1.52171,  1.5708,  1.61988,  1.66897,  1.71806,  1.76715,  1.81623,  1.86532,  1.91441,  1.9635,  2.01258,  2.06167,  2.11076,  2.15984,  2.20893,  2.25802,  2.30711,  2.35619,  2.40528,  2.45437,  2.50346,  2.55254,  2.60163,  2.65072,  2.69981,  2.74889,  2.79798,  2.84707,  2.89616,  2.94524,  2.99433,  3.04342,  3.09251,  3.14159,  3.09251,  3.04342,  2.99433,  2.94524,  2.89616,  2.84707,  2.79798,  2.74889,  2.69981,  2.65072,  2.60163,  2.55254,  2.50346,  2.45437,  2.40528,  2.35619,  2.30711,  2.25802,  2.20893,  2.15984,  2.11076,  2.06167,  2.01258,  1.9635,  1.91441,  1.86532,  1.81623,  1.76715,  1.71806,  1.66897,  1.61988,  1.5708,  1.52171,  1.47262,  1.42353,  1.37445,  1.32536,  1.27627,  1.22718,  1.1781,  1.12901,  1.07992,  1.03084,  0.981748,  0.93266,  0.883573,  0.834486,  0.785398,  0.736311,  0.687223,  0.638136,  0.589049,  0.539961,  0.490874,  0.441786,  0.392699,  0.343612,  0.294524,  0.245437,  0.19635,  0.147262,  0.0981748,  0.0490874};
    CArray data3(test3, 128);

    cout<< "Sample size of 128: " << endl;
    fft(data3);
    for (int i = 0; i < 128; ++i){
        std::cout << data3[i] << std::endl;
    }
}

```
